While it isn't the peak of Half-Life's offerings, the writing and animation remains state-of-the-art, while Valve finds interesting new ways to iterate the core gameplay formula presented in Half-Life 2. It seems even at its worst, Half-Life remains one of the best series' to handle gameplay-narrative mix, never letting control be taken away from you, and thusly did I never question the emotions or motivations of the characters or how the story was progressing. When it comes to flow, Half-Life doesn't surrender its pacing for something outlandishly mundane. The game provides enough believability in everything you encounter, and I believe it is a signature of what makes this franchise great. Levels are cleverly transitioned, the writing is snappy, and fluently conveys all the beats the story works towards. The physics of the Source engine is endlessly entertaining to play with. It doesn't carry the weight of prior installments well, but it still has a strong soul, and a story to tell with enough expansiveness to what Half-Life 2 introduced.

Bonjour à tous, aujourd’hui on se retrouve pour la review de [u][b]Half Life 2 Épisode 1[/b][/u]

[h1]C’est quoi Half Life 2 Épisode 1 ?[/h1]
HF 2 Ep 1 est un jeu de type fps aventure en solo sorti en 2006 et développé par Valve.
Comme son nom l’indique, c’est la suite chronologique de Half Life 2, et notre but va être de quitter la Cité 17 en compagnie d’Alyx.

[h1]Ce que j’aime[/h1]
[i]-Une suite intéressante bourré d’action
-L’univers toujours aussi WAW
-Des détails de ouf pour un jeu aussi vieux
-Le bon vieux pied de biche de Gordon[/i]

[h1]Ce que j’aime moins[/h1]
[i]-Toujours les écrans de chargement qui pop d’un coup et qui casse l’immersion
-Un manque d’originalité au niveau de certain dialogues
-Une durée de vie très courte ( environ 3h en prenant son temps )
-Un prix un peu élevé pour sa durée de vie ( perso je l’ai eu en promo donc attendez les soldes )
-Les IA qui te bloquent parfois à des moments où il faut courir[/i]

Bref, c’était ma review sur HF 2 Ep 1 et on se donne rendez vous pour la review d’un autre jeu. BYE !!
Recomendo, e muito! a única coisa que tenho a reclamar é que achei um pouco curto. Mas tudo bem, Episode One é tipo uma dlc, então faz sentido ser curto!
As a First time player, this episode felt like a epilogue to the Main game. Fun and Short.

A great expansion to a fantastic game and story line. One flaw I have is near the end where you have to export these soldiers back and forth to the same location, and it gets pretty tedious. Other than that I have no complaints.
Better than HL2. Why did they stop?

Synopsis: Gordon Freeman (you) and Alyx Vance see a part of the Citadel tower go boom. Thanks to your trusty mcguffin, the Vortigaunts, you are whisked away to safety amid rubble. There, Alyx and her robotic pet, Dog, uncover you. Bad news, the Citadel core is going to explode and you don't have enough time to flee. Both you and Alyx must suppress the core meltdown to buy enough time to flee City 17 successfully. That's your objective. Any questions Mr. Freeman?

Controls:
WASD = Locomotion
E = Pickup Interact
Left Mouse Button = Shoot
Right Mouse Button =  Gravity Gun Pull
Space = Jump
Shift = Sprint
F = Flashlight

Mechanics: Use your uber gravity gun to pull and push things away. Don't worry about weapons for now, you'll find em later.
Grab some flares, rocks, cinder blocks, chairs, tables, benches, and crates to fling at zombies in the City 17 underground metro.

Verdict: A player familiarized with the game can spend 2-3 hours to 100% the game's achievements. You get 3 hours of content from this entry of the Half Life series. Play it for the continuity if you already own Half Life 2.

这一部在剧情上没有过多推进，重返、离开，过程中更多写入侵者的黑暗面，像制造幽灵、改造生物之类，真正与入侵者碰面发生在第二章。在人物上更多写艾利克斯，从这一部开始，艾利克斯变得更加主动，更加人性，为第二章的结局做辅助。

从作品命名就可以看出这一部游戏是Half Life 2与Half Life 2 Episode 2关系在一起的纽扣，我觉得它是阅读小说前的前言，第一章仅仅描述了Half Life世界的雏形的抽象观念，第二章才是Half Life核心故事的开始。
